<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 0+"
    pfs=""
>
[Clothing](/Equipment.aspx?ID=15)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 287 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

<title
level="2"
right="Item 0"
pfs="Standard"
>
Clothing (Ordinary)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 287 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Price** 1 sp

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

Ordinary clothing is functional with basic tailoring, such as peasant garb, monk’s robes, or work clothes.

<title
level="2"
right="Item 0"
pfs="Standard"
>
Clothing (Explorer's)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 287 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Price** 1 sp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** L

</row>

</column>

---

Explorer’s clothing is sturdy enough that it can be reinforced to protect you, even though it isn’t a suit of armor. It comes in many forms, though the most common sorts look like clerical vestments, monk’s garments, or wizard’s robes, as members of all three classes are likely to avoid wearing armor. For more information on explorer’s clothing, see [its entry in the armor category](/Armor.aspx?ID=2).

<title
level="2"
right="Item 0"
pfs="Standard"
>
Clothing (Fine)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 287 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Price** 2 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** L

</row>

</column>

---

Fine clothing, suitable for a noble or royal, is made with expensive fabrics, precious metals, and intricate patterns. You can wear only one tool set of light Bulk with fine clothing, instead of the normal limit of 2 Bulk.

<title
level="2"
right="Item 3"
pfs="Standard"
>
Clothing (High-Fashion Fine)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 287 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Price** 55 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** L

</row>

</column>

---

You gain a +1 item bonus to checks to [Make an Impression](/Actions.aspx?ID=50) on upper-class folk while wearing high-fashion fine clothing.

<title
level="2"
right="Item 0"
pfs="Standard"
>
Clothing (Winter)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 287 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Price** 4 sp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** L

</row>

</column>

---

Winter clothing allows you to negate the damage from [severe environmental cold](/Rules.aspx?ID=642) and reduce the damage from extreme cold to that of severe cold.
name: Clothing (Explorer's)
